item.title: Resume Revamp
item.description: We’ve currently been hiring at work and I’ve seen about 200+ resumes in a short amount of time. While reviewing them, I made the realization that the visuals of a resume effected me more than I thought it would. Which made me also realize it might be time to update and upgrade my resume both in terms of visuals, content and flow.

item.title: Connecting to ProtonMail Bridge with K-9 Mail on Android
item.description: Recently I decided to look into moving away from GMail and start using a different mail service and landed on ProtonMail. My one gripe is their Android App is not great and has some nagging issues. So I wanted to see if I can use a much more well-known mail client for Android, K-9 Mail.

item.title: Removing Google Fonts & Other 3rd Parties
item.description: Next on the list is to remove as many 3rd Party dependencies as I can. This change was a really quick one and thus a really short post.

item.title: Lazy Loading Images & WebP
item.description: Next on my list of optimizations I wanted to accomplish (and eager to learn) was Lazy-loading of images and using a “modern” image format for the web.

item.title: Materialize
item.description: Working my way through optimizations I decided to pivot visuals for a little bit before going back. I’ve always been a fan of Material Design and figured I would give a shot at trying to implement some of their guidelines.

item.title: Removing FontAwesome
item.description: Next target of optimizing on my Hugo site is to minify or remove FontAwesome. After a bit of investigating I decided to just remove it all and handle the SVGs that I will be using myself.

item.title: Minimizing CSS in Hugo
item.description: First target of optimizing my Hugo site was scrubbing the CSS. I’ve been doing some manual cleaning of it, but also having automated scrubbing would be ideal.

item.title: Environment & Hosting Setup
item.description: So here is a rough overview of how I setup my repos and hosting environment.

item.title: Hello Hugo
item.description: The first topic that should talked about is the reasoning behind me choosing Hugo to make this site.

item.title: Hello World
item.description: The last time I had a “proper” personal site was back in the Geocities/Angelfire days and figured it was a good time to make a new one.

item.title: Tyler Childerhose
item.description: Tyler Childerhose SKILLS Technical C#, C, C++, Java Javascript, PHP, HTML, CSS Python, Lua, Batch, Shell SQL, ElasticSearch, CosmosDB/Gremlin Unity3D Visual Studio 2013-22|Code, Eclipse, XCode, Android Studio Android SDK, iOS SDK, Facebook SDK/API, Google Cardboard SDK .NET/Core, ASP.NET, Apache Tomcat, SmartFox, Terraform EntityFramework/EFCore DevExpress/DevExtreme, Magento2 Azure, AWS Gradle, Apache Ant, Atlassian Bamboo, Azure DevOps, Jenkins Docker, Docker-Compose, VMWare, VirtualBox Atlassian Confluence, Atlassian JIRA GIT, SVN, NUGET, NPM Windows, Linux, Unix, MacOS Non-Technical Excellent problem solving and adaptation skills I take pride in all of my work Able to work comfortably in both team and solo environments Hobbies include Boardgames, Video Games, Homebrewing and anything related to Technology EXPERIENCE Apparatus GS | Lead Software Developer | 2022-07 → Present | London, ON General Responsibilities Github Admin and maintain Company’s Github repo Constructed release procedure Pull Request/Code reviews Branch and User management Azure DevOps In charge of managing all aspects of Azure DevOps Created and maintained build pipelines using Azure DevOps Monitor and Scale Up/Down App Services, Databases, Cacheing, etc.
